sentences: Margaret Bell-Byars (born July 29, 1962) is an American gospel musician, who is a traditional black gospel and Christian R&B recording artist.
She started her music career, in 1980, when enrolled at Oral Roberts University, signing in their choir.
Her only studio album, Over and Over, was released in 1991, with Warner Alliance Music.

Bell-Byars was born on July 29, 1962, in Detroit, Michigan, to Jesse Garfield and Mildred Bell, where her father was the pastor of Mount Everett Church of God in Christ, while she was raised with two older sisters, Charlene and Vanessa.
